meanings.definition: A type of door that folds in the middle.
meanings.sent1: The bifolds in the hallway open up to reveal the garden.
meanings.sent2: He installed new bifolds to separate the living room from the dining area.
meanings.sent3: The bifolds in the house were so squeaky, they sounded like a chorus of birds.
meanings.sent4: Her heart opened like bifolds, revealing layers of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The creak of the bifolds echoed through the empty room.

meanings.definition: A type of wallet that folds in half.
meanings.sent1: She kept her cash neatly organized in the bifold.
meanings.sent2: He reached into his pocket and pulled out a worn bifold.
meanings.sent3: The bifold was so full of receipts, it threatened to burst at the seams.
meanings.sent4: His bifold held memories of past adventures, tucked away in its folds.
meanings.sent5: The leather bifold exuded a faint scent of cologne.
